segments.text: I see the water from the sink just pouring onto the floor, and it's making a big mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right there, but she hasn't noticed the water yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit disgusted seeing the water just flowing all over the floor like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and it's going to make the floor all slippery and dirty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should really tell her about the water before it causes a problem.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are too busy trying to get cookies to notice the water either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one slips and falls because of the water on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a bit frustrating to see the water just flowing like that and no one doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit sad seeing the kitchen in such a state of disarray.
segments.speaker: PAR
